intro: Spilanthes heterophylla, commonly known as the variable spilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the genus Spilanthes within the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf morphology, with leaves ranging from linear to broadly ovate. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Spilanthes heterophylla is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
